clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Hyoscine-N-butylbromide (HBB, Buscopan) in Augmented Labour Among Primigravidae
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised Control Study: The Effect of Hyoscine-N-butylbromide (HBB, Buscopan) in Augmented Labour Among Primigravidae

brief_summary.textblock: This study compares the duration of active phase of labour in women who received buscopan and those who don't.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomised control study involving primigravida in labour who require pitocin augmentation. Once patient require augmentation, patient will be randomised into intervention group (receiving intravenous buscopan 1ml or 20mg) and control group (intravenous normal saline 1ml). Both fluids are colourless. The primary outcome is duration from augmentation to os fully. The secondary outcome are to look on mode of delivery particularly any caesarean section due to failure to poor progress, maternal side effect (dry mouth and tachycardia) and baby outcome (apgar score and neonatal intensive care unit admission)

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Comparison between participants who receive hyoscine and those who do not.
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants and care provider are blinded from the treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion until delivery up to 12 hours

secondary_outcome.description: Mean body mass index in kg/m2

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From onset of regular contraction to cervical dilatation of 10 cm up to 24 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Mean duration of first stage of labor in hours

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From cervical dilatation of 10cm until delivery of fetus
secondary_outcome.description: Mean duration of second stage of labour in hours

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From delivery of fetus until delivery of placenta
secondary_outcome.description: Mean duration of third stage of labour in hours

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion up to 42 days after delivery
Through study completion up to 12 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who delivered vaginally or via caesarean section

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion until delivery up to 12 hours
From time of intervention up to 2 hours after
From time of intervention up to 4 hours after
From time of intervention up to 6 hours after
From delivery of neonate up to 1 minute after
From delivery of neonate up to 5 minutes after
From delivery of neonate up to 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of neonates require admission to neonatal intensive care unit admission

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion up to 42 days after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who develop side effects to treatment

arm_group.description: Participants receive intravenous bolus of 1ml (20 mg) Hyoscine
Participants receive intravenous bolus of 1ml normal saline

intervention.description: Intervention is given once a participant is in established labor
Intervention is given once a participant is in established labor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primigravida
- Vertex presentation
- Term gestation (37-41w)
- Active phase of labor (4cm with regular contraction at least 2:10)
- Spontaneous labor
- Oxytocin augmentation
- Maternal height â‰¥150cm
Exclusion Criteria:
- Multiple pregnancies
- Previous uterine surgery
- Hypertensive disease in pregnancy
- Gestational diabetes on treatment
- Clinical estimation of fetal weight >3.8kg
- Induction of labor
- Meconium stained liquor
- Allergy to hyoscine
- Medical contraindication to hyoscine (i.e Myasthenia gravis, glaucoma, megacolon)
